A4.text: The 2023 genomic study found broad affinities between mainland Pictish genomes, Iron Age Britons, and presentâ€‘day people in western Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland, and Northumbria, supporting a local Pictish origin.

A5.text: The Picts were a group of peoples in what is now Scotland north of the Firth of Forth, in the Early Middle Ages.
